metadata.title: CVE-2016-2120 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
An issue has been found in PowerDNS Authoritative Server versions up to and including 3.4.10, 4.0.1 allowing an authorized user to crash the server by inserting a specially crafted record in a zone under their control then sending a DNS query for that record. The issue is due to an integer overflow when checking if the content of the record matches the expected size, allowing an attacker to cause a read past the buffer boundary.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2016-2120` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

pdns-backend-bind - 4.0.2-1
pdns-backend-geoip - 4.0.2-1
pdns-backend-ldap - 4.0.2-1
pdns-backend-lmdb - 4.0.2-1
pdns-backend-lua2 - 4.0.2-1
pdns-backend-mysql - 4.0.2-1
pdns-backend-odbc - 4.0.2-1
pdns-backend-pgsql - 4.0.2-1
pdns-backend-pipe - 4.0.2-1
pdns-backend-remote - 4.0.2-1
pdns-backend-sqlite3 - 4.0.2-1
pdns-backend-tinydns - 4.0.2-1
pdns-ixfrdist - 4.0.2-1
pdns-server - 4.0.2-1
pdns-tools - 4.0.2-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pdns package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.2-1').
